ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the technicalities of drawing and a great deal of confidence.
I learned how to open my mind and see people and art in new ways.

This course allowed me to feel more confident about my drawings. I started the course drawing with very tentative and light lines, but ended up just going for it by the end. I am especially self-conscious of my drawings (as I know they are not particularly good) but taking this course was a really good way for me to start to get over that.
Drawing and visual analysis
Ways to look at drawings and skills to be able to do them
drawing as a generative and reflective practice
I felt that I greatly improved my drawing ability. I developed an original style that feels like my own. I draw far more confidently now.
I  became more confident in drawing

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Maybe a paper syllabus, but I liked how unstructured it was
fantastic course

Strength: priority on drawing time in class, Rob has some great insights, little homework

Weaknesses: few crits- would have liked to comment on peers work earlier and hear comments on my own work
I thought we spent too much time working with ink but that is simply a matter of personal preference.
Weakness - not being able to accept as many students in the beginning!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I absolutely recommend this course  as a non-visual artist, there was a lot for me to learn about drawing, and Rob made it enjoyable and comfortable. You'll learn concrete skills that'll make you a much better drawer, and you'll also gain a lot of confidence.

I would recommend this course if you are interested in learning to draw and learning about art from a very knowledgeable professor. If you are taking this class hoping to learn drawing in a traditional way, this might not be the right class for you. We did not get any formal instruction in how to draw depth or proportions, for example, and I would have appreciated a little guidance in that. However, Professor Storr made a compelling case for why that's not the best way to learn how to draw. The class is pretty laid-back and not a lot of work, just make sure to keep up with your daily sketchbook.
Basic Drawing was so enjoyable that it didn't even feel like a class. It was a joy to attend twice a week.
Yes its super fun and not that much work
I would recommend this to anyone who wants a chill class. Its not that much work. Even though youre in class a lot, its pretty therapeutic and fun. Also a good way to get a humanities credit.
Take it with Rob
Absolutely! It is an easy workload and very interesting. Im not an art major and I really appreciated the class.
Yes. Rob Store is what makes this class amazing - he is fascinating and changed my perspective on drawing slightly every class
Definitely- great for learning about myself, setting aside time to draw, and learning a new skill!
I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who has any interest in art.
100/100 recommend!
